result.execSummary:
The defendant Sebastian F Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence,

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.

No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol or upon violation of any terms of probation.
Comply with all rules of probation or extended supervision and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
Cooperate with agent.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (unless previously done).
Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at $0.00.
Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sebastian F Shaw

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sebastian F Shaw in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Sebastian F Shaw.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 : The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- 6 months in HOC as condition time STAYED.
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol or upon violation of any terms of probation.
- Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.
- Comply with all rules of probation or extended supervision and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Defense Letter to Court re: Plea & Sentencing, filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Sebastian F Shaw not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Sebastian F Shaw.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense requests Speedy Trial date. Court sets Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Defense may file a Motion to Suppress.  Defense ordered to file its motion prior to the Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sebastian F Shaw in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Sebastian F Shaw in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sebastian F Shaw appeared by video means with Attorney.    
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION TO ENTRY MADE ON August 9, 2022:  Court ordered $2000 signature bond.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sebastian F Shaw in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Sebastian F Shaw in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sebastian F Shaw appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
